definition: to be used up/to be exhausted
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.chinese: 难道一切都毫无疑问地丧失殆尽了吗？

sentences.english: In the worst-affected areas, nearly all the livestock were lost.
sentences.chinese: 在震灾最重的地区，几乎所有家畜丧失殆尽。

sentences.english: He so overelaborated his jokes that they lost their humour.
sentences.chinese: 他把笑话讲得太过详细，以致其幽默性丧失殆尽。

sentences.english: His grandfather’s wealth, made in railroads, was lost during the war.
sentences.chinese: 他的祖父的财产来自铁路，却在战争中丧失殆尽。

sentences.english: The loss of all his belongings rammed home the need to insure against fire.
sentences.chinese: 他的家产丧失殆尽，这使他痛感火灾保险必不可少。

sentences.english: Eventually, the benefit from two pairs of eyes becomes negligible.
sentences.chinese: 最终，两双眼睛的优势会丧失殆尽。

definition: to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to completely lose (one's dignity, vitality etc)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to melt like ice and break like tiles/to disintegrate/to dissolve
to go up in smoke/to vanish
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
